p:
Faecal samples were visually investigated, and non-diet surface contamination was removed ( i.e. invertebrate decomposers or biological matter such as grass). All samples were weighted on a digital scale, transferred into a 20 cm diameter 750 μm sieve, gently rinsed with 500 mL water, and the off-cut water was collected for sedimentation. Sediments (2 mL) were transferred to a petri dish for identification of earthworm cilia following standard procedures
46 . Diet components were separated into 11 dietary categories ( Amphibia, Arachnida, Aves, Diplopoda, Gastropoda, Insecta, Malacostraca, Mammalia, Oligochaeta, Reptilia and Plantae) and identified to the lowest possible taxonomic resolution. Diet components that could not be allocated to any specific category were classified as “Unidentified”.
